# 2024 Massachusetts Republican presidential primary

| map_size = 250px
| map_caption =

| image1 = January 2025 Official Presidential Portrait of Donald J. Trump.jpg
| candidate1 = Donald Trump
| color1 = 283681

| popular_vote1 = 343,189
| percentage1 = 59.56%
| delegate_count1 = 40
| image2 = Nikki Haley (53299447738) (cropped).jpg
| candidate2 = Nikki Haley
| color2 = fe6100
| home_state2 = South Carolina
| popular_vote2 = 211,440
| percentage2 = 36.69%
| delegate_count2 = 0
}}
The 2024 Massachusetts Republican presidential primary was held on March 5, 2024, as part of the Republican Party primaries for the 2024 presidential election. 40 delegates to the 2024 Republican National Convention will be allocated on a winner-take-most basis. The contest was held on Super Tuesday alongside primaries in 14 other states.
Endorsements
Former county officers
* Tom Hodgson, former Bristol County Sheriff (1997–2023) (working with Trump campaign in Massachusetts)
Organizations
*Massachusetts College Republicans
}}
}}
* Hannah Kane, 11th Worcester district (2015–present) (campaign co-chair)
* Kim Ferguson, 1st Worcester district
* Paul Frost, 7th Worcester district (1997–present)
* Joseph McKenna, 18th Worcester district (2015–present)
* Matthew Muratore, 1st Plymouth district (2015–present)
* Mike Soter, 8th Worcester district (2019–present)
* David Vieira, 3rd Barnstable district (2011–present)
Individuals
* Jennifer Nassour, former chair of the Massachusetts Republican Party (campaign co-chair)
* Mike Heffernan, former budget chief for former governor Charlie Baker (campaign co-chair)
* Peter deSilva, "business leader" (campaign co-chair)
Individuals
* Amy Carnevale, chair of Massachusetts Republican Party (2023–present)
}}
